column4: is there a way to avoid daemons auto-starting when doing an apt-get upgrade inside chroot?
one source, so you may want to find more evidence that this works - http://lifeonubuntu.com/how-to-prevent-server-daemons-from-starting-during-apt-get-install/
is that "cat < /usr/sbin/policy-rc.d" command really correct on that page you gave?  the file does not exist
that's why I suggested you second-source it. It's not on an official wiki or site I know, and only has one comment to say it works
seems to be incorrectly coded for the apparently purpose of creating that file
the cat is reading the file that does not exist
just sudo vi then file then.
I don't understand what needs to be done
is it supposed to create this file?
create the file with the contents on the webpage using whatever method you know how to use. Or second-source a similar solution
between cat and EOF
it suggests that from the webpage, but I suggest you second-source conformation of this solution
find another site that confirms that this is a solid solution
best to be safe if it's not clear what the repercussions may be
... looks like this is confirmation ... http://serverfault.com/questions/29544/how-do-i-stop-ubuntu-from-starting-daemons-ive-not-explicitly-asked-to-run
yep - a bit old, and it does explain the pitfalls
running the script with that "thing" in a fresh instance now ... should see in a few minutes
it worked !! ... I do suggest if people ask for this in the future, give them the serverfault link instead ... it doesn't have the command typos
I just googled it for you. I don't know this stuff
well you had the right thought to google ... I didn't when I did it (came up with unrelated stuff)
once I had the info you found, googling that got more
yeah - all good
